title: Limitation of gender inequality data on map

content.description:
Note: The value of the Gender Inequality Index is between 0 to 1, with 0 being 0% inequality, or women and men faring equally, and 1 being 100% inequality, or women faring poorly in comparison to men.
Source: United Nations Development Programme, 2017.
content.question: Which of the following is an important limitation of the data in the map?

choices.label: There is a bias in the method of data collection in authoritarian regimes, which leads to the inaccurate categorization of countries.
There is no explanation of how gender inequality is defined or measure, which leads to an incomplete analysis.
The proportion of women to men varies across countries, so there is no way to make cross-national comparisons.
The data are from every country in the world, which means there are too many variables to draw accurate conclusions.

content.answer: There is no explanation of how gender inequality is defined or measure, which leads to an incomplete analysis.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain possible limitations of the data provided.
